DataElement.preferredName: Reproductive System Findings Supplemental Qualifiers Dataset Breast Female Breast Development Tanner Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent the stage of breast development in females, referencing the Tanner scale of physical development in children, adolescents and adults based on external primary and secondary sex characteristics.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Reproductive System Findings Supplemental Qualifiers Dataset Breast
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: _A dataset containing supplemental information, specifically non-standard variables, to parent records in the reproductive system findings domain:One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Reproductive System Findings Supplemental Qualifiers Dataset
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A dataset containing supplemental information, specifically non-standard variables, to parent records in the reproductive system findings domain.

Concepts.longName: Reproductive System Findings Supplemental Qualifiers Dataset
Concepts.definition: A dataset containing supplemental information, specifically non-standard variables, to parent records in the reproductive system findings domain.

Property.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces ova. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, or cultural gender role distinctions, or both._One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest._Processes that involve and promote formation of more mature organs, organ systems, or organisms; general development. (NCI)_A scale of physical development in children, adolescents and adults based on external primary and secondary sex characteristics, such as the size of the breasts, genitalia, and development of pubic hair._An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Tanner Stage 5 - Areolar mound recedes into single breast contour with areolar hyperpigmentation, papillae development, and nipple protrusion
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Mature female breasts have developed. The papillae may extend slightly above the contour of the breasts as the result of the recession of the areolae.

Concepts.definition: Mature female breasts have developed. The papillae may extend slightly above the contour of the breasts as the result of the recession of the areolae.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Tanner Stage 4 - Areola elevated above the contour of the breast, forming a “double scoop” appearance
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The areolae and papillae elevate above the level of the breasts and form secondary mounds with further development of the overall breast tissue.

Concepts.definition: The areolae and papillae elevate above the level of the breasts and form secondary mounds with further development of the overall breast tissue.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Tanner Stage 3 - Breast tissue palpable outside areola; no areolar development
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The breasts and areolae continue to enlarge, although they show no separation of contour.

Concepts.definition: The breasts and areolae continue to enlarge, although they show no separation of contour.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Tanner Stage 2 - Breast bud palpable under the areola (1st pubertal sign in females)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Elevation of the breasts and papillae may occur as small mounds along with some increased diameter of the areolae.

Concepts.definition: Elevation of the breasts and papillae may occur as small mounds along with some increased diameter of the areolae.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Tanner Stage 1 - No glandular breast tissue palpable
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Only the papilla is elevated above the level of the chest wall.

Concepts.definition: Only the papilla is elevated above the level of the chest wall.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: general description of an individual's physical appearance and vital status.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Female Breast Development Tanner Scale Scale
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces ova. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, or cultural gender role distinctions, or both._One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest._Processes that involve and promote formation of more mature organs, organ systems, or organisms; general development. (NCI)_A scale of physical development in children, adolescents and adults based on external primary and secondary sex characteristics, such as the size of the breasts, genitalia, and development of pubic hair._An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

Concepts.definition: A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces ova. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, or cultural gender role distinctions, or both.
One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.
Processes that involve and promote formation of more mature organs, organ systems, or organisms; general development. (NCI)

A scale of physical development in children, adolescents and adults based on external primary and secondary sex characteristics, such as the size of the breasts, genitalia, and development of pubic hair.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueDomain.origin: Tanner Scale/Stage:Tanner JM. Growth at adolescence. 2d ed. Oxford: Blackwell, 1962.

DataElement.origin: Tanner Scale/Stage:Tanner JM. Growth at adolescence. 2d ed. Oxford: Blackwell, 1962.
